DARE I SAY IT.Definition: used to say that you agree or think that something is true

ACQUIRED TASTE.Definition: something that you may not like at first, but begin to like after you have tried it

ENCOUNTER.Definition: a meeting, especially one that happens by chance

OFF-LIMITS.Definition: If an area of land is off-limits, you are not allowed to enter it

QUINTESSENTIALLY.Definition: in a way that is the most typical example or most important part of something

TABOO.Definition: a subject, word, or action that is avoided for religious or social reasons

IRONY.Definition: a situation in which something which was intended to have a particular result has the opposite or a very different result

MOCK.Definition: to laugh at someone, often by copying them in a funny but unkind way

CONVEY.Definition: to express a thought, feeling, or idea so that it is understood by other people

CONTEMPT.Definition: a strong feeling of disliking and having no respect for someone or something

SELF-DEPRECATION.Definition: the quality of trying to make yourself, your abilities, or your achievements seem less important

ASPECT.Definition: one part of a situation, problem, subject, etc.

VITAL.Definition: necessary for the success or continued existence of something; extremely important

STRAIGHT FACE.Definition: a serious expression on your face that you use when you do not want someone to know that you think something is funny

AMUSEMENT.Definition: the feeling of being entertained or made to laugh

LAUGHTER TRACK.Definition: a separate soundtrack for a recorded comedy show containing the sound of audience laughter

ON SCREEN.Definition: used to refer to something or someone seen or appearing on a television or computer screen

COMPONENT.Definition: a part that combines with other parts to form something bigger

MUNDANE.Definition: very ordinary and therefore not interesting

STORYLINES.Definition: (in a book, film, play, etc.) the plot (= the series of events that happen in it)

MONOTONY.Definition: a situation in which something stays the same and is therefore boring

ELABORATE.Definition: containing a lot of careful detail or many detailed parts

INNUENDO.Definition: (the making of) a remark or remarks that suggest something sexual or something unpleasant but do not refer to it directly

DOUBLE-ENTENDRE.Definition: a word or phrase that might be understood in two ways, one of which is usually sexual

ALLUDES.Definition: to mention someone or something in a brief or indirect way

DEADPAN DELIVERY.Definition: looking or seeming serious when you are telling a joke

STEREOTYPES.Definition: a set idea that people have about what someone or something is like, especially an idea that is wrong

SHIPWRECKED.Definition: an accident in which a ship is destroyed or sunk at sea, especially by hitting rocks, or a ship that has been destroyed or sunk in such an accident

SHY.Definition: nervous and uncomfortable with other people

TRAITS.Definition: a particular characteristic that can produce a particular type of behaviour

BIASED.Definition: showing an unreasonable like or dislike for a person based on personal opinions
